intro: Malleola andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman malleola, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas or near freshwater sources. Due to its limited geographic range, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
